comments.author: achowe@snert.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1

Embed one VLC or Windows Media Player 10 plugin into a web page using <embed> tag and the attribute mute="yes" works correctly; embed two or more VLC or WMP10 plugins, each with mute="yes", and it does NOT.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using a local HTML file like:

<html>
<body>

<embed type="application/x-vlc-plugin"
		 name="tile1"
		 autoplay="yes" mute="yes" loop="yes" width="200" height="150"
		 src="file:///c:/Documents and Settings/All Users/Documents/My Videos/Forporn.avi" />
<embed type="application/x-vlc-plugin"
		 name="tile2"
		 autoplay="yes" mute="yes" loop="yes" width="200" height="150"
		 src="file:///c:/Documents and Settings/All Users/Documents/My Videos/DUIStop.wmv" />

</body>
</html>

2. Load it into the browser.

Actual Results:  
Both videos play sound.

Expected Results:  
Expected BOTH videos to be silent.
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1

Embed one VLC or Windows Media Player 10 plugin into a web page using <embed> tag and the attribute mute="yes" works correctly; embed two or more VLC or WMP10 plugins, each with mute="yes", and it does NOT.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using a local HTML file like:

<html>
<body>

<embed type="application/x-vlc-plugin"
		 name="tile1"
		 autoplay="yes" mute="yes" loop="yes" width="200" height="150"
		 src="file:///c:/Documents and Settings/All Users/Documents/My Videos/Forporn.avi" />
<embed type="application/x-vlc-plugin"
		 name="tile2"
		 autoplay="yes" mute="yes" loop="yes" width="200" height="150"
		 src="file:///c:/Documents and Settings/All Users/Documents/My Videos/DUIStop.wmv" />

</body>
</html>

2. Load it into the browser.

Actual Results:  
Both videos play sound.

Expected Results:  
Expected BOTH videos to be silent.
comments.creator: achowe@snert.com

comments.author: achowe@snert.com
comments.creator: achowe@snert.com
comments.text: I suspect loop="yes" also fails with two or more <embed> of the same type. Not tried mixing media players of different types.
comments.raw_text: I suspect loop="yes" also fails with two or more <embed> of the same type. Not tried mixing media players of different types.

This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
